# Assessment Criteria

## Components

:::{.panel-tabset}
### Mode 1: One Midterm Exam

- **20% Assignments and Participation**
- **40% Midterm Exam**
  - Thu, 08 May
  - Simple and Multiple Linear Regression
  - 60 minutes
- **40% Final Exam**
  - Thu, 26 June
  - Entire course content
  - 120 minutes

### Mode 2: Two Midterm Exams

- **20% Assignments and Participation**
- **20% 1st Midterm Exam**
  - Thu, 03 April
  - Simple Regression
  - 40 minutes
- **20% 2nd Midterm Exam**
  - Thu, 22 May
  - Multiple Linear Regression, Testing and Inference
  - 40 minutes
- **40% Final Exam**
  - Thu, 26 June
  - Entire course content
  - 120 minutes
:::

## Grading Scheme

- The components are **weighted** as outlined above. The final grade is then determined by the following scale:

| Grade |                | from   | to      |
|-------|----------------|:------:|:-------:|
| 1     | Very Good      | 87.5 % |         |
| 2     | Good           | 75.0 % | < 87.5 %|
| 3     | Satisfactory   | 62.5 % | < 75.0 %|
| 4     | Sufficient     | 50.0 % | < 62.5 %|
| 5     | Insufficient   |        | < 50.0 %|

: {.striped .noborder}

- **No rounding** is applied.

# Statistical Software

## R, Stata, Python 

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="70%"}
<ul>
  <li class="fragment" data-fragment-index="1">The focus of this course is on <strong>theoretical foundations</strong>, but we will also discuss how to <strong>apply concepts</strong> using real data.</li>
  <li class="fragment" data-fragment-index="2">You will also work with data in the <strong>homework assignment</strong>.</li>
  <li class="fragment" data-fragment-index="3">
    You are generally free to choose which <strong>software</strong> you use to complete the tasks (results should be more or less the same):
    <ul>
      <li class="fragment" data-fragment-index="4"><strong>R</strong> is widely used, open source, and free. Code examples in this course are provided in R.</li>
      <li class="fragment" data-fragment-index="5"><strong>Stata</strong> is proprietary but preferred by some economists.</li>
      <li class="fragment" data-fragment-index="6"><strong>Python</strong></li>
      <li class="fragment" data-fragment-index="7"><strong>Eviews</strong></li>
      <li class="fragment" data-fragment-index="8"><strong>Julia</strong></li>
      <li class="fragment" data-fragment-index="9"><strong>Microsoft Excel</strong> (just don't)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>
